channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Why Temple Mount flashpoint?
item.description: Renewed clashes over the holy site have stirred tension in Jerusalem. But why now?

item.title: Knifeman cuts U.S. star in China
item.description: Basketball star Brittney Griner was cut Monday by a man with a knife while she was on a bus the day before a game with her Chinese team.

item.title: Man, charged for feeding homeless
item.description: Arnold Abbott handed out four plates of food to homeless people in a South Florida park. Then police stopped the 90-year-old from serving up another bite.

item.title: SEALs warned on bin Laden raid
item.description: A U.S. commander issues a terse warning to Navy SEALS, that's seemingly directed at one who published details of the Osama bin Laden mission.

item.title: Is this beginning of the end for EU?
item.description: Does a referendum promise mean Britain could 'accidentally' exit the EU?

item.title: 'Celebrate fall of Berlin Wall'
item.description: The Berlin Wall is a reminder to people everywhere that tyranny can't suppress the will of those yearning for freedom, says James Baker, U.S. Secretary of State when the wall came down.

item.title: Airstrikes target Islamists
item.description: U.S. airstrikes against ISIS targeted the Islamist rebel group Ahrar al Sham for the first time in Syria, a monitoring group says.

item.title: U.N. has Syria chem. weapons plan
item.description: A U.N. official has a message for those worried about chemical weapons in Syria: A plan is in motion to do something about them.

item.title: ISIS 'beat children'
item.description: Children were tortured by ISIS after they took school exams, says a human rights group which adds the boys were also forced to watch beheading videos.

item.title: Attraction of ISIS. Why?
item.description: Reza Aslan examines the appeal of ISIS and why the group is able to successfully attract so many recruits.

item.title: Why West must roll back in Iraq, Syria
item.description: Last month, the Yemen-based branch of Ayman al-Zawahiri's international terrorist network, al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP), released a worrying statement calling on Muslims around the world to forget their differences and renew their efforts to carry out operations against American targets, be they civilian, governmental, military or diplomatic.
